body.p:
To his Excellency
Gov J. F. Robinson of Ky
Being well acquainted with A. K. Johnston for the last Eighteen months or more who was convicted at the last term of the Jefferson Circuit Court for Stealing, for the Term of one years

We the undersigned are perfectly Satisfied in our minds That he has been frequently not in his right mind and his conduct previous to that Act was uniformly that of a Gentleman and Honest man he lived and boarded with a portion of us during That time And from all we can or ever did learn he is of respectable parentage We Therefore Ask and pray your Excellancy will pardon him as you may not know the undersigned we refer you to the Signers below as to our Credibility and standing

With to home in boarding
W. Lam
Amanda T. Lynn
Geo. E. Lynn
Mrs Mercy R. Shanks
A. J. Ray
C P Merriman
C Duvall
I believe him not to be always in his right mind
D. M. Gazlay

John H. Merwin
the prosecutor in the case
Subscribed and Sworn to before me, by W. Lynn, Amanda Lynn, Geo. S. Lynn, Mrs. M. R. Shanks A J Ray, D. M. Gazlay and C. F. Merwin & C Duvall John H Herman, this sixth day of February 1863.
Thos Mitchelll J P J C

We the undersigned Jurors in the case of the Commonwealth against A. K. Johnston convicted of Felony at the last Term of ^the Jefferson Circut^ C. S. Court and sentenced to the Penitentiary for one year, do cheerfully recommend him to the clemency of the Governor for pardon

John H. Rosske
M. S. Gross
Henry Deppen
William Talbut
J Crabb
Wm R Gray
Geo McKinney
V, C, Kendall
James Simmons
A. J. Oldham

I, James P Chambers clerk of the Jefferson Circuit Court in the State of Ky, do certify that the above named Jurors, are the same who tried and convicted (in said Court at its January term 1863.) the above named A K Johnston, for one year
In testimony whereof I hereunto set my hand this 16th day of February 1863.

State of Kentucky.
Jefferson County. } Sct

This day personally appeared before me Thos Mitchell, a Justice of the peace, for said county, Nathan, White Kennedy who being of lawful age, well known to me, and duly Sworn, Stated that he was well acquainted with the signers of the within petition, and to the best of his knowledge and belief, were persons in which every reliance might be placed on their veracety and intelligence.
Nathan White
Subscribed and sworn to before me, by Nathan White this 7th day of February, 1863.
Thos Mitchell J. P. J. C.
I have no hesitation in endorsing what Mr Lynn & others have sworn too in the above and would recommed the pardon of A. K. Johnston

Tho Reaugh
day Watchman of the 4th Ward of the City Louisville
I know many of these signers, and they are reliable men
J P Harney
We who sat on the Jury to try A K Johnston Recomend him to to your mercy for pardon --

Pettn of A. R. John
Jefferson Cir Ct
Pardon granted
27 Feby 1863
J F Robinson
Isd Feby 27. 1863
Send to Hon J. H. Karm
